intro_text: The patrol comes across a hatchling lizard.
decline_text: The patrol decides to look for other prey.

success_outcomes.text: r_c drops into a crouch and stalks towards the hatchling lizard. {PRONOUN/r_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/r_c/pounce/pounces} on it, swiftly killing it with a bite to the back of the head.
r_c drops into a crouch and silently treads towards the hatchling lizard. At the last second, the hatchling lizard looks up, but r_c is quick to pounce and cut off its escape.

s_c drops into a perfect hunting crouch and stalks the oblivious hatchling lizard until {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} {VERB/s_c/are/is} in striking distance. The hatchling lizard almost slips away, but s_c catches it with one paw and flings it towards {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} mouth for the killing bite.

fail_outcomes.text: The patrol narrowly misses the hatchling lizard.

intro_text: The patrol looks around for something to disguise their scent while hunting.
decline_text: On second thought, maybe not.

success_outcomes.text: They can't think of anything that would work, but their hunt goes well regardless.
A snowy patch will do! The plan works, and their hunt goes well.
s_c leads them to some rain deer dung on the slopes - it's not clean, but it's extremely effective, and the patrol hunts well.
s_c tells the patrol to roll in a patch of garlic to disguise their scent, which works perfectly. It's a funny taste to wash off their pelts though.

fail_outcomes.text: The patrol finds nothing to disguise their scent, and no prey either.
The patrol finds no prey; it seems like all the prey was scared off because of their stench!

intro_text: r_c's mentor assesses {PRONOUN/r_c/object} by sending {PRONOUN/r_c/object} on a solo hunt.
decline_text: r_c asks {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} mentor to do the assessment some other time.

success_outcomes.text: r_c manages a skillful catch, and brings it back to the camp to show everyone!

r_c focuses completely on {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} test, slipping into a clear-eyed, focused routine of catch and stash, catch and stash. Eventually {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/have/has} caught enough to need {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} mentor's help carrying it back to camp, and the feeling seeing {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} prey stock the fresh-kill pile - {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/feel/feels} ready to burst with happiness!

It's a terrible day for hunting, the prey running sparse and alert. But s_c takes {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} time and doesn't let the conditions discourage {PRONOUN/s_c/object}, until eventually the right opportunity presents itself and {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/pull/pulls} off a perfect catch!

fail_outcomes.text: Hunting is poor, and while r_c's mentor is disappointed, they don't expect r_c to catch what isn't there.

s_c is too hasty, bouncing after first one prey, then another, and it ends with {PRONOUN/s_c/object} empty-pawed and exhausted. {PRONOUN/s_c/poss/CAP} mentor is disappointed - {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} clearly need more training.

During the hunt, r_c tumbles right down a steep slope while {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} attention is elsewhere. Bruised and sore, r_c has to report to the medicine scug den when {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/return/returns} to camp.

history_text.scar: m_c got injured as an apprentice, exploring alone.

intro_text: r_c heads out onto the mountains alone, wanting to sink {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} teeth into some prey and have some time to {PRONOUN/r_c/self}.
decline_text: r_c turns back to camp, deciding that a group hunt would be more effective.

success_outcomes.text: r_c heads off to one of {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} favorite spots in the mountains, a gully with stepped ridges running up and down its sides providing excellent ambush chances. And what do you know, {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/are/is} bush! Or {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/were/was} as far as that lanternmouse thought.

r_c finds a fat, dumb, slow eggbug, and {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} can barely drag the thing back to camp, but great Void, it's juicy when {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/sit/sits} down to eat it with {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} Clanmates.

s_c gets the chance to try out an idea {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} {VERB/s_c/have/has} been sitting on for a while. There's a hive of batflies that {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} {VERB/s_c/have/has} spotted that's particularly badly built, and {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} {VERB/s_c/dig/digs} down into one of the dens, fishing out batflies by the pawful.

The prey is running terribly today. But s_c has patience, and wisely waits for the perfect opportunity instead of getting frustrated. {PRONOUN/s_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/s_c/come/comes} back to camp with a good contribution to the Clan's stores, having had a relaxing day sitting with {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} thoughts while waiting for the prey to come to {PRONOUN/s_c/object}.

fail_outcomes.text: You can't catch what isn't there, and the prey today is very not there.

s_c starts the day with endless energy, but as one hunt fails after another, it very quickly runs dry. {PRONOUN/s_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/s_c/come/comes} back to camp, empty-pawed and prickling with frustration.

intro_text: As the patrol is checking the border lines, they hear an odd sound coming from just beyond a rock fall.
decline_text: It's probably nothing. The patrol leaves the noise alone and continues on their way.

success_outcomes.text: r_c drops down into a hunting crouch, certain that a mouse must be the source of the noise. {PRONOUN/r_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/r_c/find/finds} {PRONOUN/r_c/self} to be correct when {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/pounce/pounces} across the rocks and {VERB/r_c/return/returns} to the patrol with the tasty morsel dangling from {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} jaws.
p_l pads towards the rock fall to check on the noise when a eggbug bursts out! s_c is quick to react and snags the eggbug before it can disappear.

fail_outcomes.text: p_l pads towards the rock fall to check on the noise when a eggbug bursts out! None of the slugcats are quick enough to catch it, but at least the noise was nothing dangerous.

s_c doesn't even hesitate before splitting from the patrol to check on the source of the noise. {PRONOUN/s_c/subject/CAP} quickly {VERB/s_c/regret/regrets} {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} impulsivity, however, when an angry young blue lizard bursts across the rocks, chattering loudly! s_c gets quite the scare, but thankfully the lizard only wanted to get away from {PRONOUN/s_c/object} and escapes back behind the rocks.

r_c takes the lead in checking the source of the noise and comes face to face with an angry blue lizard! Though {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/backpedal/backpedals} rapidly, the blue lizard still gets its teeth into {PRONOUN/r_c/object} before the rest of the patrol can back {PRONOUN/r_c/object} up.

history_text.scar: m_c gained a scar from a blue lizard.

intro_text: r_c encounters a swarm of scavengers, gathered at the foot of the mountain.
decline_text: The patrol decides to hunt elsewhere.

success_outcomes.text: r_c immediately turns and heads for home to report this to {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} leader, alarmed by the sudden presence of scavengers in their territory.

Slyly, r_c uses the unusual presence of the weird scavenger to help {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} hunt, hiding on the outskirts of the area and waiting for the scavengers to flush prey towards {PRONOUN/r_c/object}. It works, and {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/leave/leaves} the scavengers to their business.
s_c spots the scavengers unloading metal boxes from their monsters, and recognizes that it can't be anything good, leaving immediately.
s_c spits in the scavengers' direction and decides to pick a different place to hunt.

fail_outcomes.text: r_c mostly ignores the scavengers as {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/hunt/hunts}, crawling into a metal box to follow the scent of food. But when {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/try/tries} to back up, the way is blocked, and there's nothing {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} can do - eventually the scavengers notice, and r_c is taken by them.

s_c has heard terrible things about scavengers, but {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} still {VERB/s_c/creep/creeps} closer when one falls and starts yowling with pain. It's a mistake, and a trap snaps shut around {PRONOUN/s_c/object}. {PRONOUN/s_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/s_c/are/is} taken out of the mountains with the injured scavenger.

intro_text: The patrol encounters a swarm of scavengers, gathered at the foot of the mountain.
decline_text: The patrol decides to hunt elsewhere.

success_outcomes.text: The patrol immediately turns and heads for home to report this to their leader, alarmed by the sudden presence of scavengers in their territory.

Slyly, the slugcats use the unusual presence of the weird scavengers to help their hunt, hiding on the outskirts of the area and waiting for the scavengers to flush prey towards them. It works, and they leave the scavengers to their business.
s_c spots the scavengers unloading metal boxes from their monsters, and abruptly tells the patrol they need to leave. Now.
s_c stops anyone from going near the scavengers, repeating that true warriors have nothing to do with scavengers and their monsters, and the patrol leaves back up the mountain.

intro_text: The patrol comes across a wide open space in the middle of the territory. The jets of vultures echo in the distance, but they're far away. Even so, the patrol can't help but mull over whether or not it's worth crossing to hunt on the other side.
decline_text: They decide it is better not to cross.

success_outcomes.text: The patrol crosses the open space and hunts on the other side.
The patrol finds a pipe running under the open space and uses it to cross. They end up with damp paws, but a successful haul of prey.

The patrol finds a pipe running under the open space and uses it to cross. They end up with damp paws, but a successful haul of prey. Upon returning to camp and washing their paws off, r_c finds that theirs have been stained by the mud from the tunnel.

The patrol stops on the edge of the open space, and s_c organizes a thorough search that finds a hidden cache of bluefruit. The emptiness of the space feels unnatural, a warning of the dangers these places bring.
s_c is patient enough to wait until there is definitely no vultures, then trots across to hunt on the other side.

fail_outcomes.text: r_c hears a the jets of a vulture, and ducks into cover just as the jaws snap behind {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} tail.
r_c is picked up by a vulture, never to be seen again.

history_text.scar: m_c was bitten by a vulture.
history_text.reg_death: m_c was carried away by a vulture.

fail_outcomes.text: r_c is picked up by a vulture, but miraculously gets free! They still fell a long way.

history_text.scar: m_c was heavily injured by a vulture, and carries the scars from it.
history_text.reg_death: m_c was dropped by a vulture and killed.

success_outcomes.text: The patrol crosses the open space and hunts on the other side.
The patrol finds a pipe running under the open space and uses it to cross. They end up with damp paws, but a successful haul of prey.

The patrol finds a pipe running under the open space and uses it to cross. They end up with damp paws, but a successful haul of prey. Upon returning to camp and washing their paws off, r_c finds that theirs have been stained by the mud from the tunnel.

The patrol stops on the edge of the open space, and s_c organizes a thorough search that finds a hidden cache of bluefruit. The emptiness of the space feels unnatural, a warning of the dangers these places bring.
s_c is patient enough to wait until there is definitely no vultures, then trots with the patrol across to hunt on the other side.

fail_outcomes.text: r_c hears a the jets of a vulture, and yowls a warning as the patrol ducks into cover. The vulture hovers for some time, but gives up on this hunt.
r_c hears a the jets of a vulture, and yowls a warning! It's a heartbeat too late, though, as a whole group of vultures decends on the slugcats and carries away as many as they can catch.

history_text.scar: m_c was bitten by a vulture.
history_text.reg_death: m_c was carried away by a vulture.

fail_outcomes.text: r_c is picked up by a vulture, but miraculously gets free! They still fell a long way.

history_text.scar: m_c was heavily injured by a vulture, and carries the scars from it.
history_text.reg_death: m_c was dropped by a vulture and killed.

intro_text: The patrol comes across a scavenger toll in a chasm.
decline_text: The patrol turns away. The risk isn't worth it.

success_outcomes.text: r_c happens to have a pearl on {PRONOUN/r_c/poss}, trading the shiny object for safe passage.
The patrol finds another path instead, finding a good haul for their trouble
s_c stops the patrol, slowly walking up to the scavengers and offering up a stolen pearl. The scavengers fall for it, and the patrol is waved through.

fail_outcomes.text: r_c tries to sneak through the toll, but is caught! A spear lands just behind {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} tail, but {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} get away.
r_c tries to sneak through the toll, but is caught! A spear soon sinks into their back, killing them instantly.

history_text.scar: m_c was speared by a scavenger.
history_text.reg_death: m_c was speared by a scavenger.

fail_outcomes.text: r_c tries to sneak through the toll, but is caught! A spear soon sinks into their back, thankfully missing anything vital.

history_text.scar: m_c was speared by a scavenger, and carries a scar from it.
history_text.reg_death: m_c was speared by a scavenger and killed.

s_c stops the patrol, slowly walking up to the scavengers and offering up a stolen pearl. The scavengers fall for it, and the patrol is waved through.

fail_outcomes.text: r_c tries to sneak through the toll, but is caught! Spears fly at the whole patrol, but they thankfully escape unharmed.
r_c tries to sneak through the toll, but is caught! Spears fly at the whole patrol for this offense, at least one killing a clanmate.

history_text.scar: m_c was speared by a scavenger.
history_text.reg_death: m_c was speared by a scavenger.

fail_outcomes.text: r_c tries to sneak through the toll, but is caught! Spears fly at the whole patrol for this offense, at least one injuring a clanmate.

intro_text: As r_c pads through the shadowy trees, the sun already hidden by the mountain slopes, {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/freeze/freezes}. Up ahead, a scavenger peers down from above, its black wings a huge backdrop to hypnotic, glowing red eyes...
decline_text: This is no creature for mortal eyes. r_c screws {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} eyelids shut, muttering prayer after prayer after prayer to the Ascended itself - and when {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/open/opens} them again, the moth-scavenger is gone.

success_outcomes.text: r_c turns tail and runs, feeling air ruffle {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} fur as something passes overhead while {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/pelt/pelts} for home, without even the breath to waste on wailing.
r_c returns home from {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} uneventful patrol.

Caution has always been in {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} blood, and this, this has to be why. Frozen to the ground so completely that the frost grows over {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} fur as {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} {VERB/s_c/wait/waits}, s_c refuses to twitch so much as a whisker until the moth-scavenger leaves.

fail_outcomes.text: All r_c remembers from then is the eyes... the glowing red eyes...
r_c doesn't return home.

history_text.reg_death: m_c was taken as the mothscav's snack.

fail_outcomes.text: The vast moth-scavenger flies off, and r_c tries to shake off the encounter - but the mountain itself seems to be against {PRONOUN/r_c/object} tonight, collapsing beneath {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} feet.

history_text.reg_death: m_c was killed by the collapsing mountain slopes, an event predicted by the appearance of the mothscav
history_text.lead_death: {VERB/m_c/were/was} killed by the collapsing mountain slopes after {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} saw the mothscav

intro_text: As the patrol heads out across the mountains, a bell tolls from above...
decline_text: It's a miros vulture, one of the birds the Clan hesitates to hunt, so the patrol ignores the queer bell it wears and moves on with their lives.

success_outcomes.text: The ringing intrigues your slugcats, leading them to where a miros vulture circles, bell tolling the death of the rain deer wedged by his antlers between a rocky outcrop. An ominous sign for the rain deer - a bounty for the Clan.

fail_outcomes.text: Ignoring the warning from the bird above, the patrol brings back an unremarkable amount of prey - and a cough that leaps from slugcat to slugcat in the dens that night.

history_text.scar: r_c was scarred by the cysts formed by their former rot poisoning.
history_text.reg_death: m_c died from the rot sickness brought to the Clan by the Belled miros vulture.
history_text.lead_death: died from the rot sickness brought by the Belled miros vulture

intro_text: The noodleflies are busy practicing their silly mating dance. app1 laughs at them under {PRONOUN/app1/poss} breath, mocking the stupid noodleflies for dropping their guard.
decline_text: A spider on a branch overhead hisses, and the noodleflies startle and take flight. Dung.

success_outcomes.text: p_l waves a tail across app1's path, stopping {PRONOUN/app1/object} with a stern stare.Remember those who've been hurt by noodleflies - beaks tearing deep, their eyes scratched, limping from sharp-toothed claws. app1 nods, and apologies. Every hunt deserves respect.

fail_outcomes.text: Leaping forward with overconfidence, app1 gets a noodlefly foot to the face and a needle jab for {PRONOUN/app1/poss} trouble.

history_text.scar: r_c was permantly marked by the barb of a noodlefly as an apprentice - but {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} survived.
history_text.reg_death: r_c died from the strike of a noodlefly encountered on a hunt as a foolish apprentice.
history_text.lead_death: from the strike of a noodlefly encountered on a hunt as a foolish apprentice
